note.p: For the basic Direct3D acceleration to work in a Windows guest, you have to install the WDDM video driver available for Windows Vista or later.
For Windows 8 and later, only the WDDM Direct3D video driver is available.

body.p: For completely unattended guest installations, you can specify a command line parameter to the install launcher:
This automatically installs the right files and drivers for the corresponding platform, either 32-bit or 64-bit.

note.p: For Windows Aero to run correctly on a guest, the guest's VRAM size needs to be configured to at least 128 MB.
